### Community Assessment and Parole Supervision (CAPS)
#### Opportunity ID: cb-248-13985772
#### Posting Date: January 31, 2024
#### Closing Date: March 1, 2024, 13:00 ET
#### Estimated Contract Value: to be determined
#### Language of Work: English or French

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a response to this Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) for Community Assessment and Parole Supervision (CAPS) services. This requirement is for the CSC in the Saint John area, New Brunswick.

The scope of work involves assisting offenders to reintegrate into the community as law-abiding citizens through the provision of programs, plans, and supervision in institutions and in the community. The Contractor must provide case management services, including supervision, risk assessment, urinalysis collection, and report writing for offenders on conditional release and those subject to a Long-Term Supervision Order (LTSO).

### Key Requirements

* The Contractor must maintain clear, legible, and detailed Case Management records, which include all contacts made with the offender, location of contact, time, and date of contact, type of contact, and name(s) of community supports, if applicable.
* The Contractor must submit Case Management reports to the Technical Authority according to the format and frequency determined in consultation with the Project Authority and CSC policy.
* The Contractor must prepare and submit a formal written report to the Technical Authority in situations requiring notification to the Parole Board of Canada, or in other exceptional circumstances.

### Language of Work

The Contractor must provide all services in the official language of the offender's choice, which is either English or French.

### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation criteria will be based on a compliant bid with the highest technical score.

### Standing Offer Duration

The contract period will be for one year, with the option to renew for three (3) additional one-year periods.

### Contact Information

Jolaine Amos
Contact Name
Email: [jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca)
Phone: (506) 269-3787

### Tender Documents

Tender documents, including the statement of work and evaluation criteria, are available for download on the Canada Buys website.

### Note to Bidders

Bidders are advised to review the evaluation criteria and ensure that their bid complies with the requirements outlined in the tender documents.
